action.action-desc: Mr. Peters (for himself, Ms. Porter, and Mr. Crow) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to improve the climate resilience of the Armed Forces and certain security forces and facilities operated by allies and partners of the United States, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Resilient Defense Assistance Act of 2022.

section.header: Climate resilience assistance and improvements of the Department of Defense

subsection.header: Inclusion of climate resilience services in certain programs of the Armed Forces

paragraph.text: Section 166a(b) of title 10, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraphs:
Climate resilience of military installations and essential civilian infrastructure.
Military support to civilian and military authorities to combat illegal wildlife trafficking, illegal timber trafficking, and illegal, unreported, or unregulated fishing.

paragraph.header: Authority to build capacity of foreign security forces
paragraph.text: Section 333(a) of title 10, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraphs:
Activities to maintain and improve the climate resilience of military installations and facilities available for use in international coalition operations.
Activities to combat illegal wildlife trafficking, illegal timber trafficking, and illegal, unreported, or unregulated fishing.

subsection.header: Contributions To improve the climate resilience of certain security forces and facilities of allies and partners of the United States

paragraph.text: Part IV of subtitle A of title 10, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in section 2350, by striking (and construction incident to base operations support) and inserting (including actions to maintain or improve the climate resilience of bases and construction incident to base operations support);
in section 2806(a), by striking acquisition and construction and inserting acquisition, construction, and climate resilience; and
by inserting after such section the following new section:

section.header: Contributions to improve the climate resilience of certain facilities of allies and partners of the United States.

subsection.text: From amounts appropriated to carry out this section, the Secretary of Defense may make contributions to the Federal share of the cost of construction, and other projects, to preserve or improve the climate resilience of—

paragraph.text: military facilities and installations of an ally or partner of the United States; or
a civilian airfield or seaport of an ally or partner of the United States that the Secretary determines is suitable for military use.

subsection.text: Funds may not be obligated or expended pursuant to this section unless such funds have been authorized by law for such purpose.

paragraph.text: The Secretary may make an additional contribution for a construction or other project for which the Secretary has made a contribution under subsection (a) if—

subparagraph.text: such additional contribution is in an amount that is greater than the amount appropriated to carry out this section; and
the amount of the additional contribution is not greater than 200 percent of the maximum amount specified in section 2805(a) for a minor military construction project.

paragraph.text: An additional contribution described in paragraph (1) may exceed the limitation in such paragraph—

subparagraph.text: if the sum of the additional contribution and the contribution under subsection (a) is not greater than 125 percent of the amount appropriated to carry out this section; and
after the end of a 14-day period beginning on the date on which the Secretary submits to Congress—

clause.text: reasons for such additional contribution; and
the source of funds to be used for such additional contribution.

paragraph.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary $10,000,000 for fiscal year 2023 to carry out section 2806a of title 10, United States Code, as added by paragraph (1)(C).
The table of sections at the beginning of subchapter I of chapter 169 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 2806 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 2806a. Contributions to improve the climate resilience of certain facilities of allies and partners of the United States.

subsection.header: Authorization of appropriations for the Defense Environmental International Cooperation program
subsection.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary of Defense $10,000,000 for fiscal year 2023 to carry out the Defense Environmental International Cooperation program.
